intro: Sphaeralcea digitata, commonly known as the desert four o'clock, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its glandular-hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the late afternoon, giving it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Sphaeralcea digitata is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
